revised_title: Experimental Researches on the Relation Between Chemical Action and the Production of Electricity
tldr: Faraday investigates the relationship between chemical reactions and the production of electricity using various metal-sulfur combinations in electrolytes. He discovers that the formation of a conducting sulfuret halts the chemical action, which in turn ceases the electric current. This finding supports the idea that the current is dependent on the chemical force present in the system.
